title: Add unit tests for classifier using TestModel
description:
Create proper unit tests for the message classifier using Pydantic AI's TestModel.

Tests should cover:
- Classification of support requests
- Classification of complaints
- Classification of bug reports
- Classification of general chat (no attention needed)
- Output validator behavior
- Retry on low confidence

Use:
- TestModel for mocking LLM
- Agent.override() for test isolation
- models.ALLOW_MODEL_REQUESTS = False for safety
- capture_run_messages() for detailed assertions

title: Add Logfire instrumentation with local OTel backend
description:
Implement Pydantic AI's Logfire instrumentation for observability. Configure to use local OpenTelemetry backend (not cloud) for privacy.

Features:
- logfire.instrument_pydantic_ai() for agent tracing
- Local OTel exporter (e.g., otel-tui or file-based)
- Trace agent runs, model requests, tool calls
- Optional HTTPX instrumentation for raw request visibility

title: Add tools to the classifier agent
description:
Give the Pydantic AI agent tools for richer context and actions:

Potential tools:
- Look up user message history in channel
- Check if user is new or returning
- Search for similar past issues
- Create issue directly (if issue tracking enabled)
- Look up documentation/FAQ for auto-responses

title: Add usage tracking for LLM costs
description:
Track token usage from agent runs using result.usage() to monitor costs and performance.

Features:
- Log input/output tokens per classification
- Aggregate daily/weekly usage stats
- Optional cost estimation based on model pricing

title: Grant bot access to moderator-only channels
description: The bot currently doesn't see messages in #moderator-only channel. Need to update Discord bot permissions to include access to restricted channels where support requests might appear.

title: Add configurable issue tracking system
description:
Create a pluggable issue tracking system that can create issues when support requests are detected. Start with GitHub Issues, then add Linear support.

Design:
- Abstract IssueTracker interface
- GitHubIssueTracker implementation using PyGithub
- LinearIssueTracker implementation (future)
- Config settings for which tracker to use and credentials

title: Add Pydantic Evals for agent quality testing
description:
Use Pydantic Evals to test and evaluate agent classification quality.

Features:
- Create test dataset of sample messages with expected classifications
- Run evals to measure accuracy, precision, recall
- Track quality over time as prompts/models change
